conflictDescription: The informal caregiver wants to decide which client data is recorded, but the older adult wants full control over sharing of vital signs and limits access to official medical staff only. These goals conflict because caregiver's control over data recording may override the user's control over sharing.
conflictingNfrPairs: Allow informal caregiver to select which client data is recorded
User controls sharing of vital signs data
Ensure client data recording respects caregiver's privacy decisions
Only official medical staff can access vital signs
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to decide myself which client data is recorded to keep their privacy safe.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person I want to control all sharing of my vital signs and only allow official medical staff to see them when I ask.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to clarify roles: the informal caregiver controls recording of non-vital data, while the older adult controls sharing of vital signs exclusively with medical staff.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to decide which non-vital client data is recorded to protect privacy.
newUserStoryADecomposition: Allow caregiver to select non-vital client data to record
Ensure recording respects client privacy preferences
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want full control over sharing my vital signs only with official medical staff.
newUserStoryBDecomposition: User controls sharing of vital signs data
Only official medical staff can access vital signs

conflictDescription: User story A wants the caregiver to decide which client data is recorded, allowing some data sharing. User story B wants no health data shared with anyone, including caregivers, fully protecting privacy. These goals are opposite and cannot be met together.
conflictingNfrPairs: Allow informal caregiver to select which client data is recorded
Do not share any health data with caregivers
Ensure client data recording respects caregiver's privacy decisions
Do not share any health data with medical staff
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to decide myself which client data is recorded to keep their privacy safe.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to share no health data with anyone, not even my nurse, to keep my privacy fully protected.
resolutionDescription: Adjust both stories to allow controlled data sharing with caregivers while respecting privacy, and define clear limits on what data is shared to balance privacy and care needs.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to select non-sensitive client data to record, so that privacy is protected and useful information is available.
newUserStoryADecomposition: Allow caregiver to select non-sensitive client data for recording
Ensure selected data respects client privacy preferences
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want to limit health data sharing with caregivers to only necessary information, so that my privacy is protected.
newUserStoryBDecomposition: Restrict sharing of sensitive health data with caregivers
Allow sharing of minimal necessary data for care
